result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A  listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

11:19 AM Defendant Julio A Sandoval Regalado in court.  Attorney Erik I. Colque Aty in court for Julio A Sandoval Regalado. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.. Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter for defendant and victim, who is sworn in by the court. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Colque requests bail modification to no violent contact with Victim A and states reasons on the record. 
Victim makes a statement to the court. 
State objects to any modification and states reasons on the record. 
Court will modify bail to no VIOLENT contact.
Atty Colque will appear by authorization at the next hearing date and NO interpreter will be needed for the next hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
To Seal Victim's Request to be Heard signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on September 23, 2022
Motion and Order to Seal Request to be Heard

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no contact with victim A (EXCEPTION: Parties can communicate through Our Family Wizard ONLY for the sole purpose of the custody and placement of the minor child(ren))  listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:59 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.Defendant Julio A Sandoval Regalado in court.  Attorney Erik I. Colque Aty in court for Julio A Sandoval Regalado. Dawn Maldonado appeared in person as interpreter and sworn in. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED AT NEXT COURT DATE.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
